import React from 'react'; import { Container, Row, Col } from "react-bootstrap"; import Santeros1 from "../images/Santeros1.png" import Pedro from "../images/PedroBergamo_anders.jpg" var canario_passarinho = "https://www.recantocaipira.com.br/duplas/canario_passarinho/canario_passarinho.html"; var furia = "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RJ8V-DpP1gM"; var condor = "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Czu7Yc6Fnmo"; var satu = "https://www.satulankinen.fi/"; var chemistry = "https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0022231316305737"; const Texts = () => { return(

Bio

Pedro Augusto de Souza Bergamo was born in Franca, a small city of shoemakers in the interior of Brazil. He was named after his maternal grandfather, who was a santero and raised by his mom and step-father. He is a biological son of Pedro Bergamo and nephew of Antonio Bergamo from the Sertanejo duo "Canário e Passarinho" .

His musical journey started at a presbyterian church playing acoustic guitar and singing, but his curiosity and hard temper led him to quit the church and start composing metal and hard rock music. In his youth, beside cover gigs, he played and sang in original rock bands from Franca alternative scene.

Some years later, his father presented him a "viola caipira", a Brazilian traditional instrument, which he showed little interest until his cousin played "O último condor" by Almir Sater on it. Since then, he started to compose music in Portuguese, influenced by Brazilian singer-songwriters like Almir Sater and Zé Ramalho.

When a friend was putting a magician act and needed original music, he wrote and performed a set of original songs in Portuguese for the act "O Fantástico Circo de Aracnídea", but the show was a flop. In one of the rehearsals, though, one magician explained to him the chemistry behind a certain magic trick, which arouse his curiosity for the subject.

He eventually earned a Master's Degree in computational chemistry from Universidade de Franca, and have his research published in "American Chemistry Society Journal". After teaching chemistry for one year in pre-university course, he moved to Finland to pursue a PhD.

In 2019, after 3 year living in Finland, he met the Finnish producer Joel Lindfors which produced and released his compositions "Lago Brasil" and "Nos dois merecemos viver".

In 2020, while visiting Brazil and heavly influenced by the work of "Ariano Suassuna", he produced in OctaSonus studios, songs from the "O Fantástico Circo de Aracnídea" infamus show, using only Brazilian instruments. The songs were "Abrahadabra", "Flores pelo céu" and "Feiticeiro Esteve Aqui".

After his return to Finland, he joined the Latin band "La orquesta del fin del mundo", where he met Rolando, Satu and Seppo. After a rearrangement of the band, he quit and formed "Pedro Bergamo & Los Santeros" with some of the integrants. The result is a mixture of latin-american folk music and 70's progressive rock.

Line-up:

Pedro Bergamo - Acoustic Guitar & Vocals

Satu Lankinen - Accordion & Vocals

Rolando Camilo - Drums & Vocals

Seppo Salmi - Electric Guitar

 ); }; export default Texts;
